segments.text: I notice the water pouring over the sink, and it’s just getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying that plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t turned off the faucet yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and she’s just standing there, oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are distracted by the cookies, but she should be paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the water is going to cause a bigger mess than the kids ever could.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is still reaching, and the stool looks like it’s about to go over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone in this kitchen is going to notice the danger before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on that plate, it’s almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
